Posts.Content: JROGBURN wrote: I HAD DEPA IN APRIL OF LAST YEAR.. OVER THE LAST FEW MONTHS I HAVE HAD VERY BAD PAIN BY MY BELLY BUTTON. YOU CAN FEEL THE KNOT ON THE LEFT SIDE OF THE BELLY BUTTON. HAS ANYONE ELSE HAD THIS PAIN AND WHAT CAN THEY DO IF IT IS SCAR TISSUE???? Thank you, Joei Dx 11/15/2007, DCIS, Stage IA, 0/2 nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: DEPA AND SCAR TISSUE PAIN JROGBURN JROGBURN

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2009 09:17AM JROGBURN wrote: NO I GO BACK ON THE 16TH OF MARCH. SO I AM IN HOPE THAT HE CAN LET ME KNOW WHAT CAN BE DONE...
Posts.Title: DEPA AND SCAR TISSUE PAIN JROGBURN JROGBURN

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2009 02:40PM JROGBURN wrote: I don't know about anyone else but my BS office visit has not costed me anything AFTER my first surgery.I am like several others on this page and I feel that my BS is the one best to keep an eye on things. I still have expander on left side and it has been a year. He will only do 30 to 40 cc at a time so that I will not hurt. I know that the insurance pays him for my visit, but I pay nothing. Go August 20 to have expander taken out and inplant put in then on to the nipps...I could not ask for a better BS...
Posts.Title: Why continue seeing surgeon after tx has ended crazy4carrots JROGBURN

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2008 04:55PM JROGBURN wrote: I had bilateral with Tram flap on right and expander on left. Done on Monday and Out on Wednesday and back to work on Monday, but like everyone has said everyone is different..dont PUSH yourself. Your body will tell you when you can do different things that is for sure. GOOD LUCK. Joei
